concise_definition: adj. 被任命的, 被祝圣的; v. 任命, 祝圣

definitions.explanation_en: To officially appoint someone to a religious position, especially as a priest, minister, or bishop, through a formal ceremony involving prayer and the laying on of hands.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过正式的仪式（通常包括祈祷和按手礼）正式任命某人为神职人员，如牧师、牧师或主教。
definitions.example_en: She was ordained as a minister in the Episcopal Church last year.
definitions.example_cn: 她去年被祝圣为圣公会的牧师。

definitions.explanation_en: To establish or decree something as if by divine or authoritative command, often implying inevitability or fate.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以神圣或权威的命令方式确立或规定某事，常暗示其不可避免或命中注定。
definitions.example_en: It was ordained by fate that they would meet again.
definitions.example_cn: 命运注定他们会再次相遇。

definitions.explanation_en: Having been officially appointed to a religious office; used to describe someone who has received holy ordination.
definitions.explanation_cn: 已被正式任命为神职人员的；用于描述已接受圣职祝圣的人。
definitions.example_en: The ordained clergy led the morning service with solemn dignity.
definitions.example_cn: 受祝圣的神职人员以庄重的尊严主持了晨间礼拜。

comparison.analysis: “Appointed”（任命）是一个更通用的词，可用于任何职位或角色的正式指派，不局限于宗教领域。而 “ordained” 特指宗教圣职的授予，具有神圣仪式和神学意义，语义更具体、更庄重。
“Consecrated”（祝圣）强调将人或物奉献给神圣用途，使其成为圣洁的，常用于教堂、祭坛或圣物。而 “ordained” 专指对人的任命，使其获得行使宗教职能的权威。两者可同时发生，但焦点不同：consecrated 是对象的圣化，ordained 是角色的授权。
“Decreed”（颁布/裁定）指由权威机构或个人正式发布命令或决定，常用于法律、政治或行政语境，不涉及宗教仪式。而 “ordained” 在作为动词使用时，常带有宿命或神圣意志的色彩，语义更具哲学或宗教深度。
